Yet so far, it's much more preferable than our older one.Even though this is a more expensive mattress (you might be able to find queen size ones at discount stores for this price), there is a visible difference in quality. Also having no chemical smells, and having health certifications, will probably make you sleep better in addition to your child.

First, all baby mattresses (no matter the brand) are shockingly expensive.  For such a small size, they are almost 50% the price of a queen or king size mattress!With the price shock out of the way, we were happy to get this for our second-born.  It is two-sided, meaning one side is for infant and the other size is when they are more of toddler age.The fabric feels soft and far better than our first-born's plastic-feeling mattress that looks like it is 100% waterproof because it is so shiny.You can use your hand and easily tell the difference in the two sides and it seems comfortable.  Most importantly, our infant son has no complaints.  This will be a nice mattress when we flip it over for when he is considered a toddler.  Good thinking and glad we don't have to buy a different mattress when he is older.

After having two babies who slept on a waterproof, hand-me-down crib mattress, now my third child is spoiled--having the nice and new product for once!This is an impressive baby mattress, and I'd never given much though to crib mattresses before. It's very soft and firm, and I've been impressed with the smart design of making a two-sided mattress. I mean, most mattresses have two sides, duh, but what a great idea to make a firmer infant side and a cushy toddler size! I love this idea.My husband and I have a new Sealy mattress on our bed as well, so I can vouch for the Sealy brand as well. I'm impressed by the softness, design, and quality of their mattresses. Even the ones for babies...which I didn't think were such a big deal until now.
Reviews.summary: My 3rd baby is spoiled with this mattress!

Reviews.reviewText: The Sealy mattress is an all-foam crib mattress made from soybeans. It doesn't have coils and it is not a two-step mattress. I have one of those that I have used previously for my grandson who is seven months old but is a large boy at about 21 pounds.  The Natural Dream mattress is considerably firmer and seems to be a high quality product.  The cover is water resistant and the mattress fits the crib very well.  I'm pleased with the product and recommend it.
Reviews.summary: Deluxe crib matress is top notch!

Reviews.reviewText: I ordered this matress for my grandchild and I was really impressed with its quality and comfort. The cover is very soft and water proof. Additionally it has a steel coil system which is something you don't find in a cheaper mattress. This Sealy mattress can be used as your child grows from a baby to a toddler as it has two sides, the firmer side for a baby and the softer side with extra cushioning for a toddler. I have seen the cheaper matresses and they are garbage, there's no comparison and your child deserves the best!  It's worth every penny of it!

This is a really high quality, top-notch mattress.  I was quite impressed with it when I received it.  A huge plus is that there was no smell and does not contain any toxic chemicals in it.  It feels so soft and plush, not cheap like other mattresses.  One side is firmer for infants and the other side is cushier for toddlers.  It's really nice to have this option for your child.  It's also water resistant, lightweight and easy to clean.  It fits well in our standard sized crib.  The only con is the price, but it really is a quality item and I would choose this over the cheaper products.  It will also last for years, so it's worth it.  Definitely recommend.
Reviews.summary: High Quality, No Smell, Two options for firmness

Reviews.reviewText: Simply put, we love this black-out curtain. Love it.We have noticed a marked improvement both in how well and how long our baby sleeps with the curtain up. It is easy to put up and easy to take down. And it is easy to transport, which will come in very handy as we travel this fall. The suction cups are sturdy once attached and need to be taken down with care (you can't just yank them off willy-nilly). But using the tab on each cup makes removing them easy to do.I can only say that I wish we had this five years ago when our first child was an infant.That would have been lovely.

Heavy material that is solid against the sunshine and outdoor light.  It is held up by suction cups and can be folded upon itself using the Velcro strips that are part of the blind.  It is very well made.  Why did I give it a 4 star rating?  Because the suction cups need special attention.  It is generally necessary to clean the window and wet the cups to get them to stick.  And even then, one or two might disconnect over the course of the night.  There are a good many cups to disperse the weight, but still they are a little bit of a weak spot in the design.
Reviews.summary: Very good blind system for travel.

Reviews.reviewText: This struck me as a great idea and I still think it is, but there are some flaws.Pros:- Effective darkening. I put it over a little less than half of a 3-panel sliding glass door in my kitchen and it definitely made a difference. I used it on a window in another room and the room went fairly dark.- Great velcro! The velcro is high-quality and using it to make the curtain the right side is very handy.- Cute design even if it's utterly unnecessary and excludes it from appealing to adults. (While I was testing it, a friend came by and was really impressed, and said, "I'd get one of these if it didn't have the pattern on it.")- Handy, portable, and you can actually get it back in its original bag if you try.Cons:- The suction cups are large but not that great. After 15 minutes, one corner fell and after 25 minutes another fell. I pressed harder, harder than I really wanted to press on glass, and they stayed for longer, but those 2 never stayed through a night/afternoon.- It's a weird size. It's not quite big enough for a hotel window (but would cover the gap in the curtains for sure). It will cover 1 panel of a sliding door really well, but definitely not 2 panels. It's tall enough though!Neutral:- Because you're sticking it to the glass, you'll get a little light bleeding around the edges.

The Gro company made the product that I always want when traveling with young kids. The Gro-Anywhere blind is a room darkening/blackening blind that is designed to go portable. The suction cups work very well; we have had no problems with it sticking securely to the windows. When placed over a window that it can cover entirely the blind is very good at darkening, even blackening the room.The problem is that the size is so odd that there are very few windows it covers...actually we haven't found one. On vacation we were excited to use this so my son could take naps in hotels or our timeshare. It doesn't fit on windows at my house. If you do find a window smaller than the 130 cm by 200 cm size it will cover it well. The problem is that if you cover only part of the window, the darkening effect is lost.So unfortunately for the window in my son's bedroom and for all the hotels and timeshares we have recently stayed in, the blind is too small to work.
Reviews.summary: Works Great...as long as the window is small enough.

Reviews.reviewText: Must-have product for any parent. Originally bought these to travel with and wound up using them to block out the light in our guest room when baby had to nap in there due to construction in his room. He slept so well.

Used this when we traveled to in-laws in Michigan for 4th of July.  My 1 year old son is very light sensitive, and usually sleeps in near black out conditions.  This lets a tiny bit of light in (better than black out curtains, but not as good as these: Redi Shade 1617201 Black Out Pleated Shade 36-by-72-Inch, 6-Pack), but he slept well using it.  Didn't have any problems with suction cups.  Very convenient for trips!

The Tiny One has slept in a blacked-out room for pretty much forever. This has guaranteed us excellent naps and sleeping through the night, but it does make sleeping at a place that is Not Home a little challenging. Hotels are usually okay as they generally have blackout curtains already, but Other People’s Homes are almost always a Nap Fail. And as any parent knows, Nap Fail = Not The Most Stellar Day.Enter the Gro-Anywhere Blind…it’s basically a gigantic sheet of black non-porous plastic with a star & moon design, with velcro and suction cups placed at incomprehensible intervals. I am certain they made sense to whoever was the project manager, but they make no sense to me…no matter, this is why you carry pony spring clamps (just search on Amazon, yes, you can buy them here) with you to just clip this on whatever curtain rod you are faced with. Of course, if the window is irregularly-sized, you might need to get creative, but the times I’ve had to use this curtain, it did a great job of blocking light and letting the Tiny One get his rest (and the mommy a well-deserved break). Not sure how strong those suction cups are really going to be to hold up a curtain, but since it’s made to be a temporary solution for Not At Home, I’d like to give ‘em the benefit of the doubt.It’s easy to pack and easy to fold and carry. The price is rather steep for what is essentially a large chunk of black shower curtain, but if I was given a choice between Nap Fails and paying $50, I’d shell out the dough.

It's a good idea and I'm glad I have it. It's thick enough to keep light out almost completely and the pattern is pretty cute, but has some limitations.(1) wide enough for an average window frame, but not much more(2) lets some light in around the edges, but is tolerable(3) cloth is very heavy and only stays up for a few hoursThese are somewhat obvious. After all, in essence, it's just a big heavy cloth with suction cups. But overall, it's well executed. I take this along with the portable play-yard/crib to grandma's house or anywhere else we expect to be during Baby's naptime.
Reviews.summary: Handy, but be mindful of the few limitations.

Reviews.reviewText: Updated: July 12, 2014: I originally gave the camera 4 stars. Since writing the review, the lag is so bad, it takes several minutes to switch or recognize the device. If I am viewing the outdoor camera and need to switch to my daughter's bedroom, it just does not compute. And if it does, it takes several minutes! Also, controlling the outdoor camera, there is such a lag, it is almost useless. My daughter went on a walk with her grandpa last night and I was hoping to watch them walk down the driveway but the camera would not move. It finally did after they were out of view. Speaking of above, most cameras I have that have add on cameras, you can view all of the cameras on one screen, split or whatnot. With this one, you can only view one. That might be a deal breaker for some.When I ordered this, I did not know what to expect. I have used Motorola products before and have been impressed by them but I have not tried a baby monitor or camera by them.Opening the box it is very simple to understand what plugs in where and what tools you will need. You will need a small Philips head screwdriver for the battery case on the monitor and a drill to mount the outdoor camera. The cords are coded with an icon of the cameras which is very easy to understand where it plugs in. I appreciate the longer cords. Both the monitor and indoor camera have longer cords that I am not used to. I am used to Lorex cameras and they have black cords and are not as long. These have white cords which blend nicely into my interior. The outdoor camera has a black cord which is perfect to keep it out of sight.I want to point out the outdoor camera is NOT weatherproof, it is weather resistant. The camera itself is inside a glass dome, it is not meant to be in direct contact with the elements. I thought about placing it on my deck but there is not enough coverage from the rain if a storm comes in. Not only would you ruin the camera you will not be able to see anything if the glass dome gets wet. I can't express it enough; weather resistant means you need to have some sort of protection from the elements. I have a front covered porch with two windows. Both windows have black shutters. I drilled it into the black shutter and it blends in nicely. I placed it there because it was well covered under the porch and also the power supply could be plugged in underneath. I tucked the wiring under the shutter and it looks very nice. With the indoor camera I mounted it above my toddler's window (inside) facing her room. Again, there was an outlet right below it.Once the cameras are plugged in, they pair instantly. I believe I read that you can't turn down the volume. I was able to turn down the volume on mine, on the monitor. However, if the camera and the monitor are out of range, it will beep to alert you. I am used to seeing `out of range' on the monitor but this one beeps instead and has a Motorola logo on the screen, you will know you lost the connection.Visibility during the day is amazing! The outdoor camera, you control it from the monitor. It turns left, right, up, and down with the buttons on the left. I have noticed there is a huge lag and sometimes it takes awhile before it moves. However, where the camera is placed, I can see the sides of the house from both sides of the camera, zoom in 2X! You can move it up and down; I am very impressed with how far the camera moves. You will hear a little whirling sound on both cameras when it is controlled with the monitor. At night the outdoor camera, the infrared is just good, not great. You can make things out but not that well. I keep the porch light on so anything on the porch I can see perfectly. If I turn it out, the night vision icon comes on and you can tell it is grainy. The indoor camera has decent night vision, I can tell if my daughter is in bed but if you need to move the camera, it does whirl as stated above and might wake the child.If you need to take the monitor around it has a kickstand and antenna to take from room to room. With the click of the `OK' button it changes from each camera. Again, there can be a lag and it takes almost a minute before the button realizes it needs to switch over to the other camera, annoying but not enough to do anything about.What I do not like:* As stated above, there is a lag when you move the camera around. That annoys me if my daughter is running around and the camera will not move.* Range is good, could be better. Oddly enough, the farther away I am, the better it works. There must be some sort of obstruction because I can be a few feet from the outdoor camera on the other side of the wall and I have nothing on the monitor. Again, it does not state `out of range' but will beep and show the Motorola logo. If I go to the back of the house, it works. No rhyme of reason. I have other devices that work in that room so I am not sure what the interference is.* The color on the monitor at night is nothing impressive. During the day, both cameras are excellent!If you need to put the monitor in standby mode, all you do is tap the power button and it puts it in standby. One touch back on it and it is on! I like this feature since you don't have to power the whole unit down. Perfect if on your nightstand and you need to turn the camera on in a second.All and all I am very impressed. I did not think the monitor size would be big enough. I have another one that is 5 inches so I thought the 3.5 would be too small, not the case. It seems perfect. It is a well designed monitor.I am going to give it a solid 4 stars. The fact that is does not always transmit and the night vision is lackluster, I am taking away a star. However, it is still a wonderful system. I have used this for a few weeks and plan to update my review if anything changes.I also wanted to add it does have an AV out. Someone noted that you can't hook this up to a TV, I believe with this cableMotorola Audio Visual Cable for MBP 33 and MBP36 Digital Video Baby Monitors, it would work. However, keep in mind if you hook it up to your big screen TV, the resolution is going to be horrible. The smaller the monitor/TV, the better.

Plug it in, start watching the cameras - it's that simple.I was impressed when I felt the heavy outdoor camera, it's made out of solid metal instead of cheap plastic.The wireless range is about the same as an 802.11g WiFi connection.  I get up to 40-60 feet through walls indoors.  It doesn't have the super long range of my Philips AVENT DECT baby audio monitor.The video quality is average (not nearly as good as pro security cameras) but you can see at night because it has infrared LEDs built into the cameras.The temp sensor is not very accurate (mismatch by 3 degrees), but it's close enough to know if your baby is overheating.There is a row of lights at the top that indicate the audio level with a gradient of green, orange, red, which is nice because you can tell that the baby is crying even if you have loud noises near the monitor such as when vacuuming.The controls are super easy to use, and the pan/tilt is fast and responsive, there is minimal latency after pushing the buttons.The outdoor camera is also useful so you know who's at the front door while you're cooking.  I installed mine to watch the pool since I have an electrical outlet near the roof eave in that area.This is a nice baby monitor for the busy person who doesn't have much time to mess around with configuration.  I didn't even have to read the manual since I could tell what the buttons do just by their symbols.I wish it had longer range because this can only reach about halfway across our house.

I don't have small children at home to worry about, but I do raise small goats called Pygora goats and always need to be able to keep a close eye on them, especially when it's kidding time. We live in the foothills where there are any number of critters that try to eat our livestock, so being able to keep my eyes and/or ears on them through the night makes me feel much better.This baby monitor isn't just for human babies, it works very well for our four legged babies as well. I couldn't be more pleased with it. It seems to be sturdily built, and the picture quality isn't bad at all. I feel much better having a way to keep my eye on my does when they are due to kid. This is perfect!

Reviews.reviewerName: Gertrude, the Innocent "Live well, laugh loud...
Reviews.reviewText: This has the best monitor I have ever seen in any of the home monitor cameras.  The picture is crisp and clear.  It is easy to move the camera around to see.  And for us direction challenged, it even has a little helper on the screen showing you which way you are turning the camera.This camera was easy to set up, as well.  It was useful straight out of the box:Put the batteries in the monitor.Attach power adapter to monitor and plug in.Attach power adapter to camera and plug in.Once I had it powered up, I pushed buttons until I figured out how to use everything.  It was easy and fun.I love the outdoor camera.  The quality is amazing.  This was also easy to set up, though I was a little nonplussed trying to figure out how to get it near a plug.  It ended up being put next to our barn door so I can see the majority of the yard and the trampoline on the monitor while in my office at the front of the house – about 150 feet away.This was a lot of fun to play with while we were learning to use it.  My teenager and I started out using this to spy on each other.  More accurately, I started out spying on my teenager and he caught me and started spying on me.  The most unfair part of this video war is that because he is a foot taller than me, he can put the camera up really high.  Now I just need a ladder.The only thing I wish this had is an outdoor speaker.
Reviews.summary: Love the sense of security & the ease of setup

Reviews.reviewText: The Motorola baby monitor is a great, well made, and thoughtful out of the box solution.  It does not contain all the features and customization that can be had with other webcams.  However, if you’re not tech savvy nor want to put in the effort figuring out other webcams, this is a great solution.Pros:-Clear, crisp image on a 3.5” screen.  Even the infrared image is great looking and easy to differentiate what your baby is doing and not just a baby blur.-The controls (to pan, tilt and zoom) are very responsive.  There is only VERY slight ‘lag’ when hitting the button and when the camera moves.-The row of lights at the top which indicate volume level where the monitor is.  This is FANTASTIC.  As a parent, you can continue to watch TV, talk to your partner, etc without constantly worrying about keeping the noise level down to hear properly.  The row of lights will simply alert you of any sound.-The outdoor camera includes all the appropriate hardware to set it up and is weather proof.  It survived a windy rain storm so far without any issues.  I installed mine to overlook the front door so I could see who was out there when I was upstairs or running around.-Literally, out of the box and you’re done set up.  The only item you really have to install is the outdoor camera.  The indoor camera/monitor is already ready to go and paired out of the box.Cons:-The cycle of the cameras (indoor/outdoor) timing cannot be changed.  You only have one choice (12 seconds).  I would have liked some customization here.  For example, on the indoor camera for a minute, then on the outside one for a quick 5 seconds or something similar.-The range.  This is probably house/environment particular, but I was only able to get a little less than 50 feet through walls in my home.  One reviewer mentioned being able to get 60 so it is definitely dependent on your particular living environment.-There is no way to stream this to your tablet/phone/internet.  It seems like this would be a very easy/cheap feature to add and was disappointed it was not included.Overall, the Motorola camera is a thoughtful out of the box baby monitor solution.  If you’re looking for a no learning curve, ready to go indoor/outdoor baby monitor set up – the Motorola is a great choice.
Reviews.summary: Easy to use out of the box solution

Reviews.reviewText: Love love love these! Make self feeding for my 7 month old easy! Highly recommend the soft tips for young babies! They're perfect and they don't leak!

I haven't used the reusable pouches yet but I love the sip caps.  It has really helped with transitioning our 4/5 month old to solids.  Especially great for on the go to prevent a huge mess too.  He picked up how to use the spout and sucked on it right away.  I still feed with a spoon at least once a day but these caps are fantastic when it's not feasible to do that.
Reviews.summary: Love the sip'n caps-great for transitioning from bottle to solids

Reviews.reviewText: I really like that I can put homemade or jar food into these pouches and let my baby self-feed. These seem to be made well -- but they are difficult to clean. it is hard to get into all of the nooks and crannies to remove the old food.
Reviews.summary: Great idea -- but tough to get completely clean

Reviews.reviewText: Love the caps, but wish I paid more attention to the size of the pouch. My perpetually hungry 18mo son inhales the 4oz pouches. Washes easy (if you get to it in a timely manner) and survived the dishwasher, still looking like new.

The pouches are ok kinda on the small side if u fill with about 4 oz are maybe a little more abd try to close pouch if will over flow I bought the combo pack for the choomee spout abd I do like those a lot a must have for using pouches so overall I paid a little more abd hit some extra pouches so not disappointed

I have used this chair for my son in restaurants ever since he was old enough to sit up on his own.  I get compliments on it everywhere I go.  It's very sturdy and to me seems safer than a restaurant high chair that could be turned over by someone.  I also like the fact that he doesn't have as much "wiggle room" in this as in a regular high chair.  My son seems to like the comfort of this seat over a high chair as well.  Plus, there is the germ factor.  Most restaurant high chairs rarely get wiped down so you never know what your little one might pick up from it.  This was definitely one of the best investments in infant gear that I made.

This chair is easy to hook to the table-- ours has a 3- or 4-inch lip on it, but it hooks on fine. I like that it has a much smaller footprint than a high chair, and lets our baby sit at the table with the rest of the family. The cover is fairly easy to take off to toss in the washing machine.

We have a small townhouse so I was not thrilled with the idea of having some large hunk of plastic featuring obnoxious characters taking up a good chunk of my living space.  A friend had used one of these hook on chairs so we looked into it.  Out kitchen table is about 2.5 inches thick on the ends (not really a skirt) so we thought this would be our best bet.  We were a little nervous about it since our 6 month old is a tiny thing at only 12 pounds and had a hard time fitting in restaurant high chairs and shopping carts.  She fits perfectly in this since the straps function so well and hug her in place.  I find the material easy to wipe down, as long as we use an actual washcloth and not a paper towel (Ahem, husband).  We attempted to take it with us on a trip out of town last weekend, but in all three places we tried to bring it to they had pedestal tables so we didn't use it.  The attached storage bag is great, though!  We use this both at our kitchen table and, more often, on the counter top breakfast bar.  The wee one is not on table food yet, and I can see how there would be a lot of "droppage" between the baby and the table/counter.  Thankfully we have a dog who is more than happy to handle that.  We did get the Summer Infant mat as well and it seems like that would help the situation.  Very happy with this purchase and would absolutely recommend it.  Oh, we got the navy fabric and it has not been showing any stains so far.
Reviews.summary: Works great, even for small babies

Reviews.reviewText: Feels really safe, love the color, and baby loves it. The trouble is baby LOVES it and likes to suck and chew on every area of the chair. She's also only 6 months old and experimenting with food is happening and messes are an everyday thing. I wish the chair came with a slip cover - or was easier to disassemble for easier deep cleaning. A simple wipe down hasn't worked for us.

This chair is beautifully styled.  That being said it didn't fit on three different tables we tried.  If the table has a standard 4 inch lip underneath it is almost impossible to get the chair to attach and even when you do it takes away from the whole "fast" aspect. Even though we did not really get to use it because of the fit issue I still love it and am considering a new table!

This chair is great.  Easy to assemble and disassemble.  Nice little pocket in the back for storage.  Easy to wipe down.  It didn't fit our dinner table so we just it at the kitchen bar area and she watches us cook.

We've been using the Inglesina chair for about seven months. It's awesome. I love having the kiddo at the dining table. We got theSummer Tiny Diner for Highchairs, Blueto go under the chair on the table. Save for the little "scoop" that catches food in the space between the table and your kid, I really hate the mat. It's hard to clean while on the table because of the raised design, and it's annoying to take the chair off the table after every meal.I kept wishing there was a tray I could just pop on and off to take to the sink. Lo and behold, (well after we had finished our registry) Inglesina made such a tray! YES! (I was far more excited about the existence of this tray than any normal human should be about something like this, but that's how much I had been hating post-meal clean-ups.)It's super easy to snap on and off of the arms of the Inglesina chair. It cleans up very easily and hasn't stained yet (despite having stain-worthy foods on it like tomato sauce or turmeric). I ended up keeping the Summer Tiny Diner Mat on underneath because of the scoop described above. It has not created any kind of a challenge with the Inglesina tray fitting or sitting right.I AM SO HAPPY THIS EXISTS. Seriously, if you are getting the Inglesina chair (which I can't recommend enough), get this tray. The price cannot be beat, especially for how much time you will ultimately save when cleaning up after your kiddo's culinary adventures.
Reviews.summary: YES. Really helps with cleaning up after meals!

Reviews.reviewText: I'm doing baby-led weaning, and this is a perfect tray for my child's meals.  The lip is really generous, so he doesn't shove (much) food off of it.  And, while he's little, the cup holder serves as a perfect garbage receptacle for peels that i'm taking off as he eats or for chunks that fall on the floor.  I love it.Fits easily in the carrying bag for the chair, too!
Reviews.summary: Perfect Accessory for the Almost-Perfect High Chair

Reviews.reviewText: Helps to keep food from getting stuck under the arms of the Inglesina Fast Table Chair. Easy to snap on and off, and rinse off or put in the dishwasher.

I have no idea why, but this tray that is supposed to fit all Inglesina Fast Chairs did not work with ours. It did not lie flat against the table but tipped up at the front (sloped towards the chair). I thought maybe the plastic was stiff and needed to "relax" a little, but it never did. I tried every which way to make it work and even communicated with the manufacturer, but no luck. Returned it.One thing I will note (assuming it had worked for us) is that the tray doesn't cover the gap between baby and table. It seems to be more about protecting your table than the floor under it. Our baby is small, so there is a fairly large gap between her and the table and she drops things through all the time.

Bought this to go with our Inglesina Table Chair. Fits over the arms perfectly and makes clean up a bit easier. We just detach the tray and spray it off in the sink and let it dry. It also helps limit the mess that gets stuck under the chair arms. Love it! We were also happy that we were able to fit it in the chair bag when on the go.

My husband found this through another website - it was hard to hunt down on Amazon for whatever strange reason. We absolutely love our Inglesina chair - we only use it and nothing else at home. The area around the chair and arms gets so disgusting (baby-led weaning), that I was nearly about to break down and get one from Ikea that I could hose down in the shower. But the tray - hooray! It doesn't keep food from falling between the baby and the edge of the table, but he actually has a lip that helps him scoop up food and it keeps the arms and table much cleaner between feedings (and the inevitable full-breakdowns and washes). It does fit awkwardly like another reviewer stated, but not enough to hate it or think it is worthless. It tilts up towards baby slightly, but works perfectly fine.
Reviews.summary: Wish I Had Known About it When We Bought the Chair!

Reviews.reviewText: I was not impressed with how hard and lacking in padding the seat was when we received it. It is very tall as well. We chose to keep it as  the seat we use in the car that is only ever used for quick errands, not long trips. I bought a Graco Nautilus for our primary car. Far more padding and feels much more solid. The price difference was big, but so was the quality looking at the basics.
Im a man and I can hardly tighten the straps.  My wife cannot pull the strap to tighten the straps.  The plastic clip across the chest does not snap well and this is only 3 months old
Reviews.summary: Dont buy, it is too hard to fasten straps

Reviews.reviewText: Love the color. The perfect seat for my child to grow with. The harness is easy to adjust for a perfect fit and its also easy to clean with a damp cloth.

We bought this booster seat based on reviews from Consumer Reports and the need for a 5 point harness until the age of 5.  That recommendation came directly from our pediatrician.  They might by large enough for a booster seat, but their skeletion isn't developed enough to sustain a crash in a side body seatbelt.I was surpised at how hard it was to find a booster seat with a 5 point harness.  This got great reviews from consumer reports, is priced great, and is very comfortable for my daugher.The reason I gave it 4 stars was because the latch sticks, and sure enough that part on the car seat has been recalled.  Still a great buy all things considered.
Reviews.summary: Great price for the much needed 5 point harness

Reviews.reviewText: Love this seat! Very comfortable, my three old can feel like a "big kid" with still being safe with the 5 point harness.  Love that it converts to a booster.  Just as a note, we have a small sedan (Mazda 3) and in order to fit this with two other boosters (we carpool for kindergarten!) I could not put the cupholders on - but not a big deal. Still a great seat!

I'd like to preface this review by stating that I have a compact car(Ford Focus, for those curious). I also now have two of these in by backseat(forward facing).First, the pros:-Incredibly easy installation and removal. When I drop my daughters off with their babysitter, I also have to drop off the carseats. It takes me 3-5 minutes tops to get both carseats uninstalled. Takes slightly longer, like 7-10 minutes to reinstall, but only because I climb into the car to put weight on both carseats to tighten accurately.-It's comfortable, and that's straight from my 4 year old's mouth. Her old carseat(a Safety 1st model) felt incredibly hard and the straps always dug in. This carseat is much better. I drove from the East Coast to the West Coast and she was very happy in her carseat and fell asleep.-Strap adjustment and replacement(if you had the one before the recall), is simple. If you are having issues with uncomfortable straps, I strongly recommend buying strap covers. There are pink ones that match this carseat too!-Lightweight. I am listing this as a pro because I frequently have to remove and carry these carseats when I drop off my children. I can carry both easily.-It's actually an incredibly cute design.Cons:-The old straps that came with this carseat before there was a recall had an issue where they would loosen, or the buckles would get stuck. Don't worry--this model comes with the new straps, and Evenflo will send you replacements for free if you have the one before the recall.-Bulky. While I can have two of these installed in my backseat, they swallow my backseat. Luckily I only have two kids and I don't need to use the middle seat. I can still fit a diaper bag and/or purse between the seats and that works fine. Because of the bulkiness, however, I imagine that installing this carseat in the rearfacing position might be an issue. My car is compact so that's mostly why I bring it up.I will amend my review if any issues pop up. I've had one of these for almost a year, and the second for a week, no car wrecks.

I really wanted to love this - the color is gorgeous, well padded (although I wish it had strap covers on it) and Evenflo is a great brand that I would feel safe trusting my child's safety to.  But it was too big to use rear facing in our car (we have a Toyota Sienna, so the seats have to go behind the front driver/passenger seats - if we had the option of putting it in the middle between the two seats it would have been a different story).  My husband is tall, and the only way to make it work would have required pushing the front seats forward so far it would have been uncomfortable for anyone riding up front.  We had to return it.

I saw these at costco and decided to get one. They were out of them at the store so we looked online. These are cheaper on Amazon since we got free shipping, so we just got it from here.I hated our previous graco car seat for smaller babies, such a pain to deal with and really uncomfortable for my baby. This one has lots of padding, removable head and bottom padding too. We specifically got this color since it's darker and will hold up better to see-able stains.It was easy to install, the same size as our other car seat, and baby likes it fine. We did have some problems with one of the straps not tightening the same as the other one, so one would be super tight and the other loose. It was our fault as it was a little tangled underneath. Fixed that and now it tightens just fine.Haven't had any problems with heat due to fabric, baby is comfortable and we trust the car seat for it's safety.
Reviews.summary: Great, comfortable car seat that's also affordable

Reviews.reviewText: Not a big fan of this car seat for a few reasons:1. it is bulky, but lots of car seats are so this didn't affect my rating, just thought it would be an fyi2. maybe we got a defective one, but one side is really difficult to click into the bottom latch, my son cries everytime I try because I'm putting so much pressure on him, I'm so afraid I'm going to pinch him with it.3. loosen the straps because of #2 you say? Well the other side, the strap decides it wants to loosen itself all the time, and it's not exactly easy to tighten them and then it would be even tighter on the side that it's hard to click in as it is! Just doesn't feel safe4. The fabric is SO heavy. I got my windows tinted in my car because we live in Florida and it obviously gets hot down here, and my car was always swelteringly hot. He would always be flushed and sweating in the back seat. The tinting has cooled down the car, but not him. He is still sweaty and red faced when I go to get him. The car is cool, but I think the fabric is just holding the heat and not pulling it away from him. I hate itWe've decided to return it and get something else

Originally written February 13, 2014, but for some reason original product page seems to have been removed. Original review is still up on my public profile."I bought this seat so my daughter could stay rear-facing for longer, plus I loved the design of the Nicole. It rear faces up to 40lbs and 40in, and forward faces up to 65lbs and 54in. My 3 1/2 year old son is just about to grow out of his convertible, an Evenflo Tribute V, and the Tribute forward faces for as long as the Sureride rear faces. Think about that for a second. With higher weight and height limits for both rear and forward facing, of course it's going to be bigger. It has to accommodate bigger children after all. I don't know why I wasn't expecting it to be monstrously huge, though. With those numbers, if you're going to get it for a newborn, infant, or young toddler, expect the seat to expire before they grow out of it while forward facing.I have yet to actually install it in my car, a '07 Jeep Liberty. I have memo---nightmares from almost 3 years ago from just trying to get the tribute to fit rear facing. It's definitely better suited for a mini van. I will update this review periodically.*EDIT*The car seat didn't actually take up as much room in my car as I was afraid it was going to. The front seat can't be back all the way like my husband likes it, but it does leave a comfortable amount of room. I'm not exactly a short woman, either. It is rather difficult to install, but no more than most convertible car seats in the rear facing position. I'm planning on getting it checked out by a tech just in case. If you have problems installing you car seat(s), I suggest you visit your local inspection site as well. I've had no problems with the harness or buckles, and my daughter has had no problem falling asleep in it."June 5, 2014, I would like to add a few things. The car seat is huge, no doubt about it, but don't be afraid. You do not have to have a huge vehicle in order for the car seat to fit. It fit in my old vehicle, a 2007 Jeep Liberty. When I went searching for a more fuel efficient car, fitting my car seats was a deal breaker. Surprisingly, it also fit (while rear-facing) a 2012 Honda Fit with my 5'11 husband able to comfortably sit in front of it. If you are not familiar, a Honda Fit is a subcompact car, much much smaller than an SUV. Unfortunately we were recently involved in a bad automobile accident that totalled the new car. I do not recommend subcompact cars now knowing they don't tend to fair well in accidents due to their small size, but I do recommend this seat as well as my son's booster (Evenflo Maestro). They held up very well, and our insurance will be replacing with the same models. Also, the date this was manufactured, I did not receive a model with a recalled buckle, explaining why I never had a problem with the buckle sticking. If you have purchased this seat, make sure to check the Evenflo website to make certain you do not have a recalled buckle.

This swing has a rotating mobile and plays music or bird sounds with music or bird sounds.  It has a soft, fuzzy bunny in the swing seat, but the ears are short so it looks a little like a dog.  The mobile has leaves and birds that go up and down and rotate.  It plays familiar children’s songs in a lullaby genre.  It was fairly easy to put together.  There is an allen wrench included, but I also used a screw driver.  It took about 40 minutes start to finish and that includes going back to look at the instructions when I made a slight mistake with the canopy cover.  Don’t put the pole through anything even if it looks like it belongs there.It takes up about four square feet of floor space.  I put mine in a corner because I felt safer with it there.  When the feet are not spread out enough one will rise slightly off the floor.  That does not make me feel safe with my grandson.  There are six settings for the swing, but on six it will rock and one foot picks up off the ground.  There are straps to fasten your baby into the seat, over the shoulders, across the waist and through the legs, but we will not be using any settings over one or two.  Those are working fine for us.  We rotate the music or the nature sounds with music since my grandson doesn’t seem to have a preference for one or the other of those yet.  He does like the music, however.  What he really loves is the shiny surface of the mobile as it rotates.  We have found this most helpful on those days that he cannot settle down and rest.  The motion helps when we cannot walk the floor any longer.
Reviews.summary: When you are tired of walking the floor

Reviews.reviewText: If you own this product, the motor WILL fail.... not a matter of if.... when.  Lasted 4 months.... died on a night that my wife and I were completely exhausted and left us with even more lower back pain.This is not a product that you should leave your kid in but for us, it was great at rocking him to sleep so we could more easily transfer him to the crib from time to time.
Reviews.summary: it was great at rocking him to sleep so we could more ...

Reviews.reviewText: Overall, I like this Fisher-Price swing, but there are a few features that I am not too thrilled with and could be improved.Pros:This swing, as well as swings in general, are a godsend to parents who are trying to calm and sooth their little ones.The seat looks and feels very comfortable.The unisex design is suitable for both boys and girls, so you can use the same swing with children of different genders.The little mirror above the swing is very intriguing to the little ones.The hanging characters move around, which is another useful distraction.The swing features sixteen tunes and sound, and gives the little one (as well as his or her parents) a much needed variety.Cons:Not easy to assemble.The construction seems fairly flimsy. It looks like it could be easily knocked over or damaged if you accidentally bump into it.I've had some problems with the swinging motor failing over time in my other swing, but so far I have not had any trouble with this one. If anything changes in that regard I'll update this review.

My Granddaughter has a baby that is a couple of months old, and they love this Cradle N Swing.It is very soft inside for a newborn. The baby falls a sleep in this to the music very easily. Its amazing.There are 16 different tunes.The baby can be rocked or this can swing.Really like the idea that this can run on batteries or plug it in. It's nice to take it to the park, and use the batteries.Baby likes to look at the birdies & little mirror hanging above.My other Granddaughter has the other older one almost like this one. That said, this New one is Awesome.my 11 month old Granddaughter  wanted to get into hers the other day,and it still fits and she loves it.So do not think its just for infants.There is so many features to this Swing. , Amazon gives a great description..You will not be sorry you bought this, it is Awesome, and will last with other Children.

I've had the pleasure of owning two of Fisher-Price's Cradle 'N Swings as a mother of three children now. I've used two other swings and feel like I've seen countless others between family, friends, and taking care of other's children. It's important to note that not all babies like swings. My first and third children LOVED the swing and would spend hours upon hours relaxing and sleeping in them. My middle child would not have it, no matter which swing she was in, she just didn't like it. That said, if you're planning on having more than one child, I consider a swing to be a worth-while investment. One child may not take to it, but for the kids who DO like them, the swing is GOLD. So helpful to young parents.The Fisher-Price Cradle 'N Swing is truly the Cadillac of baby swings. Before owning one, I thought they looked overly large and silly in photos. Then I read reviews and decided to get one for ourselves, and I'm so glad we did. This newer model is the second one we've owned and it seems to have a more powerful motor (doesn't need to be pushed to really get going) and maybe a little sturdier. Our other recent model could be a tad squeaky. I'd have to "adjust" it sometimes while running and baby was sleeping in it, because it'd start to squeak while running.It's soft and cozy and in a great position for babies, especially those who are colicky. The mirror and mobile offer a great entertainment for babies wanting to chill out and rest. My baby often fell asleep for hard naps while in this swing. The music is great, and the volume can be controlled. The motor is quiet, especially once the swing really gets going, it seems even quieter. The design is neutral and attractive. It is actually not as obtrusive as the photo might look. This swing is nice and big, but not at all TOO big.The baby can swing in two directions, you can easily set it to side-to-side or turn it so baby goes front-to-back. My baby liked both. He would nap in this swing for a good long time and it was such a blessing to have. I'd definitely recommend this swing. As another reviewer put it, this is the best swing out there. It's the top model, I think! If you have any questions that I didn't ask, feel free to leave a comment and I'll do my best to answer.

I have the previous version of this swing and really love the upgrades on this newer model.Some updates:The swing sits a bit higher off the floor, about 6 inches higher.There are two additional music options, a daytime/playtime music option and a nighttime/sleeptime music option in addition to the nature sounds.Smart Swing Technology- Basically the motor seems much stronger. It gets the swing going without you having to push it to get it started. It also is able to swing a 14lb baby fast, the older model had trouble maintaining speed as the baby grew. The slow setting is still slow enough for those that like a gentle swing.Some great feature that remain the same:The cover is washable. It is easy to remove and looks brand new every time you wash it.The swing folds up easily for storage, one click and it is small enough to slide into a closet.It plugs in! This really saves on batteries. You still have the option to use battery power if need be though.Overall I believe this is the best swing on the market. I have always been loyal to the Cradle N Swing and this newer model is a solid investment for anyone with a new baby.

Simply the very best swing on the market!  I used this swing at a friend's house for my son and I immediately had to replace my existing swing with the Snugabunny Cradle 'N Swing.  It keeps your child happy and snuggled comfortably.  The cover is easily washed in case your baby spits up.  There is no getting around the fact that a swing is a bulky item that will be planted in a prominent spot in your home.  This one is as visually appealing as you can hope for.  It blends into your decor and isn't as obnoxious as a lot of other ones can be.
Reviews.summary: Your baby will love it, and your home decor won't suffer from it!

Reviews.reviewText: Baby and the dogs like the Fisher-Price Snugabunny Cradle 'N Swing (With Smart Swing Technology) but only the baby is allowed to actually swing.  The dogs can watch and listen and become hypnotized with luck.  Since this can be plugged into the wall, there's little worry about the swing stopping suddenly.  Messes can be quickly cleaned and the cover is washable, yay.  Babies enjoy looking around and with this swing, they are entertained by the assortment swinging above.  With a base having a wide girth, this feels very secure and we have not had it operate too fast for our comfort.  Assembly is required, it took us about 15 minutes to put it together.  We like it and look forward to using it until baby weighs 25 pounds.
Reviews.summary: Soothing movement, sounds and visuals makes this a winner

Reviews.reviewText: This Snugabunny Cradle 'N Swing is probably one of the better Fisher Price Swings presently on the market, but even so, it's just not as good as the ones Fisher Price made years ago.  This is the fifth, yes fifth Fisher-Price cradle swing I have owned.  The first one was from thirteen years ago and had just three speeds and no fancy bells or whistles like sounds or motorized mobile.  It was basic and it was great.  I used it for my first two children and then passed it on to a friend who used it for her baby.  The second one was a papasan swing that I brought second hand at a yard sale for our third child.  The swing had already gone through two children and was used briefly for my third baby and then passed on to another friend who got a ton of use out of it and passed it back to me for my nephew.  The third swing, and the one I like best is the aquarium swing that a friend gave us for our third baby.  I prefer that one because it has an a/c adaptor and has the same excellent construction as our original cradle swing.  The fourth one, was the Rainforest swing which is a current Fisher Price swing and one which I recommend you absolutely avoid (you can find my review of that swing by clicking on my name at the top of this review).  Now let's move on to the review of this Snuggabunny swing.I was really excited when I found out I was going to have the opportunity to review this swing.  It has neutral colors, much like the papasan swing I had picked up at a yard sale, which meant it would blend in perfectly with my living room and family room decor, and best of all it had an a/c adaptor so I wouldn't have to worry about keeping a steady supply of batteries on hand. As with the Rainforest swing, this one is also a bit of a bear to assemble.Assembly for this swing is a bit of a pain in the rear, but not quite as bad as the Rainforest model.  I have assembled three older versions of Fisher-Price cradle swings with relative ease. They all snapped and screwed together in roughly five to ten minutes with zero frustration.  This swing and the rainforest one, however are not nearly as easy to assemble.I'm less than thrilled with the overall construction of the swing, like the rainforest model, it also seems very flimsy when compared to previous Fisher-Price cradle swings.  The swing motor is a bit loud, but every cradle swing we've had from Fisher-Price has been a bit loud so I wouldn't hold the noise against it.  As the swing swings, the legs lift up a bit and that concerns me.  Because I question the stability of the swing, I will continue to keep my aquarium swing at the ready for the time when I need full size swing for my little one.  Presently he's very content to hang out in our very portable and well constructed Ingenuity portable swing.The music for the swing is ok.  It's not overly annoying but it's not something I'd forsee using in my house. I found the nature sounds to be better than the music.  The mobile is cute and much nicer to look at than the rainforest model.  I really dislike the mirrored dome.  It will give baby a distorted view of him/herself.  I much perfer the dome like the one on the aquarium swing to this one.The seat pad is nice and plush.  The head rest can be moved up and down to accommodate babies of differing heights, but it's pretty thin and isn't going to help prevent flat spots on baby's head.  I'd do wish the bunny headrest for seat pad was removable so a head rest like the Boppy Noggin Nest could be used instead.  The seat pad is gender neutral.  I prefer gender neutral baby gear so you don't find yourself swimming in say all pink baby gear from your first baby only to have to go out and buy all new stuff if you have a boy next.So the bottom line on this swing is it's better than the rainforest model, but I would look around to see if there's a better quality swing out there. If you have your heart set on a swing that can go head to toe or sided to side take a look at other manufacturers to see if they have a cradle swing with better construction.  If you think you can get by with a swing that just swing from head to toe I'd recommend you take a look at the Comfort and Harmony portable swings.
Reviews.summary: Fisher Price Cradle Swings Aren't What They Used To Be

Reviews.reviewText: We've owned a lot of Fisher Price swings--five in five years, in fact. While you want to know that you are getting a good product when you buy this swing (you are), you also might be pleasantly surprised to find out that you are getting excellent customer service as well. For the most part, we haven't had any issues with our swings. But there have been two occasions when we've needed to call customer service:  once when the motor died after using the swing for a year, and once when the motor was faulty right out of the box. In BOTH cases, a quick and painless call to customer service resulted in a brand new motor for the first, older swing, and an entirely new swing to replace the brand new but faulty one. Honestly, Fisher Price's customer service cannot be beat. They really are exceptional.As for the swing itself, this Snugabunny version is my favorite one to date. The swing is easy-peasy to set up and is solidly constructed. The motor is so, so quiet, even when starting up--and it gets swinging pretty quickly. I like the updated control panel; the buttons are simple and easy to operate. The mobile works as it should and is quiet.The music settings sound a bit tinny, but my baby doesn't seem to mind. There are several volume levels, too, which is nice. I was worried that the reflective "mirror" surface in the center of the mobile would distract my baby and keep him from sleeping, but he has no problem looking at himself a while and then settling in to sleep. (Yes, we have let all three of our kids use the swing to fall asleep. It really does soothe a crying newborn, so this swing is a godsend, if you ask me.)Overall, I love this product. It is made well and gets the job done--and when it doesn't, Fisher Price's customer service will back you up. You can't ask for more than that!

Of all the Fisher-Price Cradle 'n Swings, the Snugabunny pattern is my favorite.  Its non-gender colors assure this swing can be recycled from one baby to another.  I love the soft tan/light green colors with leaf design netting--nothing outlandish yet it's still childishly delightful.We've not had any problems using this swing and baby enjoys being in it.  Assembly is easy (20 minutes) and the swing is sturdy and stable.  We like Cradle 'n Swing models because they offer some features not found on other swings--plush materials, an adjustable position (recline or  slightly upright), mirrored globe, uses batteries or plug-in option, customized swinging motions and washable seat pad.  The motor has been quiet so far when in motion.  The music can quickly become annoying, but that is easily remedied by turning it off or switching to less obtrusive nature sounds.  This swing does fold up, but it still takes up quite a bit of space.  Recommended weight limit is 25 lbs.Of all the nursery items out there, we've found two indispensable infant sleeping aids.  This Fisher-Price swing andFisher-Price Newborn Rock 'n Play Sleeper,  Rainforest Friends. Like the swing, it also comes in a variety of colors/patterns.  It is is so handy for travel or keeping baby close to mom at night.  Both the swing and sleeper have been godsends for us.

WTF. The pieces don't fit together, the instructions look nothing like the product, and when i finally got some of the pieces together, the thing couldn't sit flat on the floor because it's so bent.  Made in China piece of crap is going back.  FML
Reviews.summary: This is the worst thing I've ever bought.

Reviews.reviewText: If you're looking for a swing, the Snugabunny is a great choice. I highly recommend this swing from Fisher Price.The Snugabunny swing has 6 swinging levels. The seat adjusts very easily for side-to-side or forwad-to-back swinging. It plays nature sounds and various lullabies. My favorite part about this swing and all the other The Fisher Price swings is that their cradles are outfitted with the plushest fabrics and cushioning. It's like putting baby in a cloud.The Snugabunny is great. Gender neutral colors. And come with an AC adaptor so that you can plug it in and don't have to always run it on D batteries. This for me is a BIG deal because I also have the Fisher Price My Little Lamb swingFisher-Price Cradle n Swing, My Little Lambwhich is completely the same as the Snugabunny except that My Little Lamb only takes batteries. Very annoying. I also have the Graco Glider XL Gliding swingGraco Glider LX Gliding Swing, Raffywhich is really nice and great if you don't have as much floor space because the Fisher Price swings will take up a bit of real estate, but my main compliant with the Graco Glider is that the cradle is not plush and does not have padding at all.A swing is definitely one of those items that will save your life when your baby is still in the newborn/infant phase and I highly recommend getting one to anyone who is considering adding a swing to their collection of infant care tools. And the Fisher Price swings, in my opinion, are some of the best you can buy in terms of quality and price, backed by a solid company (Mattel).When I was expecting my first child and asked my mommy friends whether I needed to by a cradle/bassinet/Moses basket for my infant, most told me-- NO. They told me to let my baby sleep in the cradle of the swing (you cannot do this for babies who are rolling). So my own baby napped and slept in a Fisher Price swing for the first couple weeks of her life in the "off" mode, of course. We would swaddle her and put her in. And I could easily turn the music, nature sounds, or the swing on when she would cry and fuss. It worked like a charm just as my friends said and I save money on not buying an extra cradle/bassinet/Moses basket. After those first couple of weeks, we transitioned her to her crib but continued to use the swing as entertainment and as a soother. I didn't use my swing as much as my friend who had two colicky babies. But it was helpful to have a swing handy all the same. And for my friend with the colicky babies, well, it saved her life!
Reviews.summary: Great Fisher Price Swing-Comes with AC Adaptor

Reviews.reviewText: Love this swing! It has to be the cutest design ever, and it works amazingly well. We had initially out our first swing up a few months ago because my daughter was getting heavier and it just wouldn't swing well. This design has a feature called smart swing and it didn't even hesitate to swing my 20 lb 9 month old.  I also love the mirrored globe in the middle of the mobile. My baby loves it! I also love the upright and recline positions and the 3 directions it can swing.  All around, I love this swing?

WoW, is this swing well built and top-notch. It seems very well built and so comfy for even a newborn.  My son and I (both bad with even a screw driver) assembled this in about 30 minutes. Just to sure we tested it with a watermelon instead of his newborn.....assembly was a success and actually instructions are very clear.The padded cradle portion is extra comfy and the bunny motif is just adorable.  The 16 sound options are very soothing and not at all annoying and the cradle to swing motions are great as well even for a newborn.This swing has been the saving grace for our new parents and newborn -- she loves it.The swing is quite pricy, but our other child has been able to use is for 2 different children and all agree it's $$ well spent.

We've gone through a few of these Fisher-Price swings. Fisher-Price seems to be the standard in baby swings, you see them everywhere, in daycares and nurseries. The Fisher-Price Snugabunny really isn't any different than their previous lines of cradle n' swings except in color scheme and mobile entertainment.Features:-- Three positions left side-to-side rocking, right side-to-side rocking, and back-and-forth rocking. Just press a button and turn the swing. Very easy to use and a must have on any swing.-- Removable covers for easy washing. Very easy to remove and put back on.-- 6 different swing speeds. Watch out because it can go quite fast on the higher setting. We mostly use the middle setting.-- 16 songs.-- Includes AC adapter or battery pack. We always end up using the AC, power cord is fairly long.-- Swinging entertainment with birds and a mirror to help sooth baby.-- Not too difficult to put together.-- Solid base, doesn't move around (at least ours doesn't).-- Straps for securing baby.Overall this is a nice swing, but it's rather plain. If that's what you're looking for, a neutral color, then this is perfect for you. I prefer something bright. Previously we owned theFisher-Price Rainforest Open-Top Cradle Swing. I liked that swing not only because it was bright and colorful and matched our son's room and colors, but it also had the tray that helped keep toys in place.All of the swings make a click-click sound that some may find annoying. The rhythmic sound has always helped put our kids to sleep.
Reviews.summary: Excellent baby swing. Not very bright.

Reviews.reviewText: I had Fisher-Price's rainforest swing that was similar to this one but it was SO loud; this one is very, very quiet and smooth and much nicer.  It has a few additional features from that one: a cozier pad; smoothly operates and more sturdy. I'll go straight to the pros of this awesome swing:Pros:Super plush and cozy for babyPuts baby right to sleep when younger; and has three directions it can swing, from side to side or forward/backMirror on top and mobile keeps baby occupied; mobile leaves move up and downPLUGS INTO THE WALL or can use battery.  This is very unusual and I love that I don't have to replace batteriesNeat variety of music and soundsVery sturdy and quietNeat little bunny toy clips onto his straps so he has something to play withCute green design can be used for boy or girlI highly recommend this swing, it's super nice, and I've tried several brands of swings.  I don't have ANY complaints!
Reviews.summary: The perfect baby swing; soft and cozy, plugs into the wall and keeps baby super happy!

Reviews.reviewText: I can't believe all the negative reviews for this product! My little one loves this swing and it has prob not saved my sanity!! She has acid reflux and colic and this is a lifesaver! It's inclined enough for her acid reflux which is great. I do feel like the mobile doesn't really get her attention but she's usually asleep within minutes of swinging anyways. I love this and would recommend it to any mom!! We haven't had any issues and it's been use everyday for almost 2 months!

This is definitely a Must Have Baby Product.  After your baby has nursed, burped, played, clean diaper and still refuses to sleep - this is the perfect time to put them in the swing.  If baby is not yet ready to sleep, she'll still hang out in the swing for 10-20 min.  If she's ready to sleep, it'll rock her to sleep in about 15 minutes.  She has slept in it for a couple of hours at a time.  This has made it so I am able to get some sleep myself, take a shower, eat, do some chores, etc..  A total lifesaver.What I like about the swing:- It's sturdy- Does not take up too much room- Attractive, gender neutral colors that go well with any decor- Quiet- Works reliably- Baby loves it- Has a mirror up top that Baby absolutely loves to look at.  Whenever I put her in the swing, she immediately looks up at the mirror.  Then the moving toys is an extra plus.- Has a very nice 5-point harness which is a must have.  There is a soft padded piece that comes up between Baby's legs, then a strap comes over from either side of the waist for a very secure waist hold.  Or you can attach the shoulder straps as well for even more security.  I use the waist straps only when I'm in the room with her and watching.  I use the additional shoulder straps if I'm going to be stepping out of the room and only monitoring her with the video monitor.- Whole thing is very nicely padded and soft, comfy and cushy.- Places Baby in a very nice position which she sometimes prefers to laying flat on her back, this makes it easier for her to fall asleep when she has some gas issues.- Great swing speeds.  Just fast enough for her to enjoy.  If the swing is too slow it's not effective at all.  I find the speeds offered are just perfect.  Sometimes I will lower the speed once she is asleep, but sometimes she will wake up when I do this so I think she definitely prefers the faster speeds- Wall plug or battery operated- You can turn it so Baby is swinging side to side or front to back.- Easy to put Baby in and lift out againWhat I don't like:- Only the strap that come up between her legs has an additional soft padding between the hard nylon strap/buckle and Baby.  The other 2 waist straps and 2 shoulder straps are just plain hard nylon.  Most of the time Baby is naked with just a diaper on and so the hard nylon straps are right up against her skin.  I don't like that.  It would have been easy to use a softer strap material or added the same padding to the other straps as well.  I don't strap Baby in it tight so it's not like it *really* matters, I just still don't like it.  Nothing but the softest things should be right up against Baby's skin!!  LOL- There was one time when the motor was clicking with every rock.  Something must've gotten unbalanced in there.  I turned it on and off and nothing worked.  It was still swinging, but there was a loud click with each swing.  It still worked, so I kind of ignored it.  Then the next time I used it, there was no noise again so it somehow fixed itself.  I have an older swing, same manufacturer, that still swings but creaks and clicks a lot - it's very loud.  It still works but is loud and sometimes it stops for no reason, but I can start it back up again.  So I do believe that sometimes there may be a problem with the motor.  But I haven't had a problem with this one other than that one hiccup and I still think it's a great product.Wonderful product, Must Have, Definitely Recommend.

We love the look. The bouncer is very colorful and comes with the fun two-sided toy bar to entertain the baby. The bouncer is cozy and it’s easy to bounce. It offers calming vibrations, music and sounds, and bold colors to keep the baby visually and auditorily stimulated. The hanging toys are fun for the baby to play with. The seat pad is machine washable, which is nice to keep it clean. It’s a good bouncer and I would recommend it.

Reviews.reviewerName: B. McCarthy "Engineer, CERT, Amateur Radio Op...
Reviews.reviewText: This is a great product for a baby. Babies can stay in it and keep entertained by the colorful features and cute sounds. It seemed very comfortable, and I was very happy with the durability. Obviously you have to supervise the baby while he/she is in it but it can help when you feel like you never get a break from holding the baby. This can be a real life saver when you want to eat. It can really keep the baby entertained. Recommended.
Reviews.summary: Fun for baby, break for mom

Reviews.reviewText: Having studied early childhood development, I agree that this toy gets 5 stars for being developmentally appropriate, safe, and interesting to infants at least 0-6 months. It hits most areas of sensory motor development (fine motor, hand eye coordination, listening, viewing, feeling textures, etc.)! It's also easy to store, clean, and portable. One huge benefit is that it's lightweight to easily move from room to room so it saves your back , unlike huge play gyms.The fisher price bouncer seat is one of my child's favorite toys! At first he did not like it and only sat in it for five minutes, because we did not put batteries in it. The batteries are a must have!!Every child is different, so it's a gamble when you buy any toy. However, most infants (0-3 months) particularly like high contrast patterns I really like that you can easily rotate the display for your baby when he gets tired of one side. Lights and music are stimulating for playtime so it keeps him busy for at least 15 min (enough time to get dinner started!!)

I was once skeptical about the value of a bouncer as a piece of necessary nursery equipment.  After my grandson arrived, I quickly changed my mind about bouncers. This is definitely an essential piece of equipment for any little one - and an even more essential piece of equipment for the adults caring for the baby.  The “Fisher-Price 2-in-1 Sensory Stages Bouncer” is even better than previous iterations of the bouncer and one that my new granddaughter loves – as do the adults in the family.Like all Fisher-Price products, the “Fisher-Price 2-in-1 Sensory Stages Bouncer” is an excellent quality item. The plastic edges are smooth; they should not injure your infant.  The colorful cloth seating area is nicely finished and the fabric is not cheap or scratchy.  The aqua shades are bright, but not garish.  If necessary and it will be, the cover removes easily for washing.The inclined seat is very useful if your little one suffers from reflux since keeping the baby upright, after feeding, for the 15 - 30 minutes your doctor may recommend can be tiring if the baby is large or it is o-dark-thirty at night.  Further, the incline is also nice because once your baby is a bit older and staying awake more, you can move the seat between rooms as you go about your daily life. This allows the baby to observe different environments and allows you to explain your activities so that the baby's language learning can advance.We found the vibrating feature helpful when the baby was fussy or when she was having difficulty going to sleep. It was soothing and helped calm her down.  When she was awake, the ability to “bounce” provided exercise and entertainment; it also helped strengthen muscles that were not yet ready for crawling.The two-sided, arched toy that can be attached is very nice feature. Unless you turn on the music or motion, the actions/tunes do not "go" continually, but require that the baby do something to activate the music, motion, or toys. This is particularly nice if you are an individual who dislikes the continuous, automated music of some infant toys.  On one side of the arch, the high contrast design and the mirror are excellent for the youngest users.  Once your little one is a bit older, the second side’s colorful parts are eye-catching and stimulate your baby's visual sense; they are bright, but not gaudy.Although rated for up to 25 lbs., the “Fisher-Price 2-in-1 Sensory Stages Bouncer” is useful up to about 20 pounds.  At that point, the baby's weight is sufficient to prevent the upright position from being particularly useful.  You may find, as I did, the “Fisher-Price 2-in-1 Sensory Stages Bouncer” is essential for any parent or caregiver - it fills a number of useful functions, is well made, and little ones love it.
Reviews.summary: Essential For Your Nursery Or For Grandma's House ...

Reviews.reviewText: My 7 week old grandson loves this bouncer a lot more then the swing he has here at my house. The cushion on this bounceris much softer then the one on the swing, and for that reason he is more comfortable in this bouncer. He will fall right to sleep in this bouncer. He also tries so hard to reach the toys that are hanging down from the toy bar, and loves looking at himself in the mirror. I have tried the vibration feature, but it just scares him right now, so I don't use it. All I have to do is softly bounce him, and he will nod right out. I put this right on the kitchen table, and let him watch me do the cooking and cleaning, and he is happy knowing I am right there where he can see me. When he gets a little older, I will use the other side of the toy bar, he loves the side with the mirror. I highly recommend this bouncer to any other one I've tried in the past.
Reviews.summary: A must have for a baby

Reviews.reviewText: The Fisher-Price 2-in-1 Sensory Stages Bouncer has all the qualities I have come to expect from baby and child merchandise offered by Fisher-Price – durability, quality, adaptability for when baby grows, utility, and lots of fun things to entertain infants and toddlers.This bouncer has three activity toys overhead, long play and baby-activated modes of play, a toy bar that removes for easy access to the baby, a secure three-point restraint, and machine washable pad and head rest.The bright colors enhance visual skills, especially eye tracking, and the black, white and red toy bar promotes facial recognition. The bouncer comes with a variety of age appropriate colors, toys, music and sounds so the baby can develop at their own pace. As baby grows older the toy bar can be turned around to offer another set of age-appropriate experiences and engagements.The bouncer has this real neat vibrating feature that helps quiet baby with its soothing feel when he/she becomes fussy or is having problems going to sleep. This product will easily outlast baby and be in fine shape when pulled out of storage for a new arrival. There are several developmental objects, fun things to do, and quality features that make this bouncer a very good buy.
Reviews.summary: Bouncer’s Good for Exercise, Engagement and Relaxation

Reviews.reviewText: Our 4 month old daughter loves this Fisher-Price sensory stages bouncer.  First of all, the bouncer is easy to assemble, and feels sturdy.  There are quite a few pieces in the box, but it only took me 15 minutes to put it together.  You will need a Philips screwdriver.  You also need a single D battery and three AA batteries to operate the sensory features.The pad is soft and comfortable, and is machine washable.  The sensory bar comes with two sides- one is for babies up to 3 months, and the other side is for 3 months and older.  The younger side has a mirror and light-up feature, while the older side has a button which plays music when turned.  It also has a faster light feature that is designed to improve eye tracking.  Our 4 month old enjoyed both sides equally.  There is also a vibration feature in the seat.The sensory bar snaps in and out easily.  It’s a pretty tight squeeze so you will have to remove the bar whenever you take baby out or put her in.  Unfortunately, the bar only has one position so you can’t move it away or closer to your baby.The seat is very comfortable and our daughter can even fall asleep in it.  Keep in mind the seat does not have different angles though.Overall, this Fisher-Price bouncer is a terrific item for a young baby.
Reviews.summary: Great bouncer to entertain your baby.

Reviews.reviewText: This bouncer is a very necessary part of any mama's baby gear. This is a newer version of the same bouncer I had for my firstborn and I'm looking forward to using this with my new baby. I really love the versatility with being able to switch from the "newborn" side to the 3+ months side. The original version could be turned, too, but it was all colorful. I hope the newborn side will be far more stimulating.early on. My first baby wasn't much interested in all the colors very early on but I still put him in it without the toy bar while I was doing other things around the house so he could see me and look around.The vibrating feature is really nice for babies who like it. My first didn't care for it much but I've heard from others that it soothes fussy babies and helps them get to sleep. My first baby figured out the kick motion when he was about 4 weeks old, and once he did, he was kicking his legs all the time like crazy! This was really a lifesaver for those times when I just wanted to take a bath but I had a baby who needed to be held constantly or he would cry. So I'd put him in his bouncer on the floor where he could see me and I talked to him the whole time which kept him happy for 15 minutes so I could wash up! Really a lifesaver for moms of newborns.I also love that the seat cover comes off easily. I machine wash mine and it comes out just fine. The plastic toys on the bar are easy to wipe down as well. It's also a great size for travel, either just to a friend's house or on road trips. Great addition to your newborn repertoire.

We haven't had a bouncer in years, so receiving one for our upcoming 4th child was something we were thrilled about. Once we received it, setup wasn't bad, although my wife did have a bit of trouble assembling it. As always, directions can usually be a bit better (video directions are the best!), but we were able to assemble it fine. The only thing we ran into was the fabric covered the on switch depending on how it was slid onto the metal bars. Also had to find some batteries, since we usually only have AA's around.Unfortunately, our child despises this bouncer. Hopefully that will change as he gets older, but at 3-4 weeks, he can't last more than 5 minutes in it without screaming. It's the same with the baby swing we have, however, so I'd say it's more due to his personal tastes versus any fault of the product.

This sensory stages bouncer is a big hit in my house! My baby girl is very content in it and fascinated by the toys, which has helped out a ton so that I can get other stuff done. I love that this works for when she's a newborn and then grows with her. She's already pretty entranced by the bright colors and vibrations and music, so I see this working like a charm for months to come. Highly recommended by a satisfied mother.

This is a nicely made bouncer.  It is very lightweight which makes it easy to move baby and seat at once. The colors are pretty and suitable for either gender.  The seat and headrest parts are machine washable.
