Also, I do think that some other brands looked more comparable to the Britax than the Graco, so please read this as more of an impeachment of Graco than an endorsement of Britax for anything other than comparison.
Reviews.summary: WARNING: May not install properly Rav 4 2010 (2005-2012 model)

Reviews.reviewText: We have been using Graco car seats for years and this is just as good, if not better than the others. It looks great and the seat is very soft and cushiony. It is easy to adjust and actually easier than our other model because of the way the straps are connected. I love how this converts into different seats as the child gets older also.It is very easy to install, but we found that some car seats do not work in some cars depending on the back seat. Not the seat's fault but the car design.My only complaint is the new strap buckle system for the straps the connect to the car. It is no longer the seat belt type of strap but a button to push. I though it would be easier to adjust the length of the strap at first, but it is actually harder.Overall great car seat and highly recommend.
Reviews.summary: Another great car seat from Graco

Reviews.reviewText: The Argos 3-in-1 seat is pretty much identical to the Graco Nautilus 3-in-1. I'm not sure if they are discontinuing the Nautilus in favor of the Argos or what, since they seem to pretty much be the same seat. It does look like the side-impact protection might be a bit better on the Argos than the Nautilus (I have both). But if you are trying figure out the different between the two seats, I don't think there is much.What I like about this seat is that you can use it for so long. I've currently got a 4.5 year old who fits very comfortably in the harness now. She is only 40 lbs, and the harness is good for up to 65 lbs. She will outgrow the harness by height before she hits the weight limit though (she's already 44" and I believe they say the upper limit of the harness is about 49"). Once she outgrows the harness she can ride in booster mode until she is big enough to not need a booster anymore.The seat was easy to install. I used my vehicle belt, since a lot of vehicle manufacturers don't rate their LATCH connectors for over 40 lbs. The latch connectors store nicely in the seat when you are not using them. Installation was very straightforward and easy to do. The shoulder straps on the harness are super easy to adjust up and down for your child since you just press the red button on top and slide up and down. The only thing I had a little trouble with was moving the crotch strap for the harness to the outer slot for my bigger child. It was only hard because I was trying to do it wrong at first. I was trying to turn the metal clip sideways to pass it through the slot, but that cause the fabric to bunch up too much. I  just had to turn it so it was skinny and it went right through.I like the built in cup holder and so does my daughter. My other car seat I had to buy a separate cup holder and it is always falling off. The Argos also has a little cubby in the side to keep other treasures your child might have. The cover is washable. Keep in mind how stains will show when you select a color. Black will hide everything but might be hot in the sun. The silver I had on my Nautilus showed all kinds of gross stains that I don't know where they came from.Overall, it is a nice seat. I like it for it's versatility. It isn't as cushy and probably comfortable as the seat I have in my other car, which is a premium (expensive) brand convertible. But the Argos will serve my child longer in the future.

This is a very sturdy and well-made forward-facing only car seat for children 20 to 120 lbs - in other words, from 1-2 years of age to way past when most children would still be willing to use it.  At some point you can convert this to a booster, which will obviously make it less safe, but you can use it as a regular car seat up to 65 lbs, which is usually around 8 years of age or so.  The booster phase just means you use only the car seat belt, and remove the built-in 5 point harness; you can optionally remove the back also.  The back may be used up to 100 lbs, and should be left on as long as possible for extra side protection.This car seat is a little heavy at 20lbs, so it is best used in one vehicle.  I was very impressed with the side-impact protection, esp. for the head, which consists of large padded plastic wings directly on each side of the head.  The headrest moves up and down with one hand to adjust the head protection for child height, and automatically secures the shoulder straps at just the right height as well, without needing to adjust the belt length.The overall car seat width is an average 19", not including the built-in cup holder in the right arm rest which adds an inch.  There are built-in straps for a rear anchor or LATCH systems; of course, traditional seatbelts work fine too, and there's even a shoulder belt clip attached to the back of the seat should you have a seatbelt that doesn't lock.  The armrests don't lift up, but they don't seem to get in the way in our car when entering or exiting.  The armrests have little cubby holes on the insides to hold small items (or dropped fries).It comes adorned with velco pads for the shoulder straps and even the 5-point buckle, which of course will soon get lost, but aren't at all necessary.  There's even a seat pad insert for smaller children 20-30 lbs which is easily removed in seconds once outgrown.  The only adjustment that is a little difficult is moving the bottom belt to the second slot for larger children; this requires removing the carseat from the vehicle and working the clip out of one slot and into the other.  It took me several minutes, but you should only need to do this rarely unless very different sized children will be using the same seat.  The recline feature only allows a slight tilt back, but it can be helpful to fit a variety of seatback slants.This is a solid choice for a safe, well-designed and sturdy forward-facing car seat you don't plan to move often!If you need a rear-facing car seat for a child under 1-2 years of age, consider a convertible seat that can be used rear-facing to start, and then turned around during their second year, such asGraco My Ride 65 LX Convertible Car Seator the deluxeGraco SmartSeat All-in-One Car Seat.  The convertible seats can generally be used up to 100 lbs and don't usually have detachable backs.  Finally, for infants or preemies who can't sit up yet, we loved theSafety 1st Car Bed.PROSStrong and sturdyExtra side-impact protectionEasily adjustableFlexible buckling options built-inBuilt-in cubbies and cupholderCONSToo heavy to move between cars frequentlyArmrests don't lift
Reviews.summary: Well-made and sturdy but a bit cumbersome to move

Reviews.reviewText: These shrink in a wash terribly which is expected BUT the blue tread around the edge is so heavy and there is so much of it that after the fabric shrunk, edges basically curled. Looks bad and what is more important feels weird when the insert is snapped in a shell. Also, after shrinkage the insert doesn't fit right in a shell - too short. Overall, I think we'll stck with Grovia hybrid system. Absorbency of these inserts is alright so far.

Love the Best Bottom cloth diaper system (covers, stay dry inserts, hemp inserts, overnight inserts).  They are super easy to use (because inserts snap in you can easily diaper a wiggly baby), super absorbent & wash clean easily!  The hemp inserts are the trimmest (for tighter fitting daytime clothes); the stay dry inserts are a little bulkier, but keep baby's skin DRY to the touch; and the overnight inserts work great for nighttime or extended daytime use.  These inserts are narrower around the groin area than other inserts, which I like for baby's ease of movement, but because of this they occasionally leak runny breastfed poop onto the Best Bottom cover.  NO PROBLEM though because the covers have leg gussets so nothing gets out onto baby's clothes. (if cover is fitted properly to baby).  For this reason, you may need a few extra covers of this brand over others that have wider inserts.  I don't mind because I like that my baby can move easily and that these are not so bulky around his groin area.  You just have to decide which is more important to you!
Reviews.summary: Easy CLOTH DIAPER system, EASY care!

Reviews.reviewText: These are now my go to inserts! I have used them with the best bottom diapers, but my favorite use for them is in my pocket diapers. These are so absorbant, that I never have any leaks and have replaced all my pocket diapers with these liners. They're slim fitting, yet can hold a lot of liquid! I even use them for overnights, I just pair them with another soaker, and I've never had a leak. LOVE them!

.- I received 3 sets of this 3 pack (9 total). The seams popped after the first washing on 7 of them (I used the delicate cycle). When I e-mailed Best Bottom they asked me to send pictures, which I did. They then proceeded to tell me that those were just “loose threads” & “did not affect the efficiency of the product”, so basically tough luck. They are definitely not just loose threads. The fabric quality is good, the construction is substandard & Best Bottoms customer service is very disappointing.
Reviews.summary: Best Bottom Customer Service Very Disappointing

Reviews.reviewText: I have the stay dry cotton in large for my 24 month old. These are amazing! They are super trim and very absorbent. We don't have any of the best bottom diapers but we use these inserts in bumgenius 4.0's, econobum, thirsties, and rumparooz covers. Never once had a leak issue. They wash great and dry quickly. No fuss inserts! Definitely recommend!

I've been using Best Bottoms for a few months and love the products overall!  I recently on a whim bought a few of the hemp inserts and I must say... they just SUCK.  My 6 month old son had a hemp liner in for appr. 45 minutes and not only had it completely soaked through, including the cover, but when I removed it it was actually DRIPPING.  Wow!  What a waste of money!Stick with the cotton liners, my son can make it about 3 hours in those.  I've also used the overnights attached to the medium cotton liners with no leaks through a solid 10 hour sleep.

They are super absorbent and incredibly soft, even after being washed and used repeatedly.  I love best bottom covers and the inserts live up to the name as well.  I have nothing negative to say about these at all!
I love these inserts.  Our son is a very heavy wetter and these are super absorbent. I love the Best Bottom diaper in system.

I'm pretty new to cloth diapers, but the Best Bottoms were recommended to me by a friend, and I must say I am very happy so far. They are super user-friendly (even for dads), they are very trim (unless you have the overnight insert in), and they wash up so easily. Because they are not all-in-ones or inserts, they dry very quickly, too. The covers can be used with other inserts such as Flip, or just plain prefolds. I chose the snaps because I read that the velcro tended to be bulky and stiffer on baby's little tummy. I am so glad I got the snaps! I have some Thirsties covers with velco, and they are definitely more bulky and stiff. When I have more money to spend I want to try the hemp inserts, as I hear they are even trimmer!

These inserts work alright but with my son being a heavy wetter they don't work so well. I am not a fan of the best bottom system just because it sucks if your baby poops. It gets all through the cover. Not a good thing if your baby has diarrea or poops a lot. Just not very convenient at all. I like contours better like kissaluvs or motherease.

I am cheap and therefor prefer the econobums.  However as my son got older, the econobums did not seem to absorb all the urine my son was putting out.  I bought these on a whim just to try something different.  This is a quality product.  It feels quality and absorbs all the urine a two year old puts out.  It snaps in nicely to the shell.  They wash nice and feel soft.  I believe the product is also made in Wisconsin which also gives me more incentive.

I ordered these after having great success with two other packages of liners and discovering how much I really like the Bestbottom line! Only problem is this pack is pilling and shedding like crazy and it gets all over everything! I really appreciate the ease of use with these covers and liners. They have a trim fit and good absorbancy but this must be a bad batch. I plan to return and re-order and hope for a better liner.
Reviews.summary: Did I get a bad batch?

Reviews.reviewText: These are great inserts.  I'm always impressed with how much they hold, especially since I've had bad experiences with pretty much every other topped MF AI2 insert I've tried before (Flip and SoftBums come to mind).And talk about stay dry! You really can't tell if these are wet unless you touch the back of the insert.
Quality isnt great to be honest. The stiching came apart after one wash!  However they are very absorbant but take VERY long to dry. Prefer prefolds.

These are my favorite inserts for my favorite diapers! Easy to clean and care for and work wonderfully! No complaints!! I buy them all the time from this seller and will continue to as long as I cloth diaper!!

These are really absorbent and super soft, but the serging began fraying at the edge after just one wash.  This happened on four of the six that I bought.  I'm just hoping this doesn't mean that they start pulling apart now.Update: It's now been four months and they're still going strong!  It's still only those 4 that remain frayed at the edges, but they're holding together well.  I'd buy again.

I've used a variety of cloth covers and inserts.  These are my favorites by far!  Let me start by saying this system is so easy and convenient.  The inserts snap in so you can have diapers ready as easy as pockets without the extra work.  And are daddy and sitter friendly!  They are super absorbent but without the smell factor that always comes with microfiber.  Thick layers, but still give a trim fit.  I'm buying more.  I wish I had tried these first.  I've got a bunch of pocket covers I won't use anymore, and a good amount of inserts that just don't perform as well.  We are using the medium sized right now, and they are absorbent enough for overnight.  That may change as he grows though.  The best absorbency I can compare these to are Thirsties hemp prefolds, which come second only because I have to fold them.  I'm a fan of the snap in ease of these.  Even if they aren't snapped in, they still work amazing in other covers.  But Best Bottoms are my fav covers too.  Trim and I love that I don't have to swap out a new cover with every change, they keep my baby dry (not in wet leaked on clothes all the time) and wash up great.

The Best Bottom system is really great, especially now that my baby is super wiggly during diaper changes--having the insert snap in place makes it a lot easier to get it on him quickly. And if he turns over and starts crawling, I can still get it on him. I also like these at night with the Best Bottom doubler. The fleeciness keeps a little of the wetness off him and the cotton/hemp is easy to launder. They do take a long time to dry because they are so absorbent--1 day in the sun or 2 days indoors.
These inserts are super absorbent. A little bulky, though. Overall, I'm really pleased with the Best Bottom system. Great diapers!

The concept of these inserts are great! They keep moisture away from baby and they snap nicely into the best bottom covers.  They are good quality as well.  A major flaw is that they just aren't wide enough for the shell.  Every time my son pooped or peed it would leak onto the leg elastic, making the system useless because I had to use a new shell every time!  Some gussets in the center of the insert could maybe fix the problem!
Bought this as a baby gift and my friend heard great things about them. They look very durable and nice.

I am new to cloth diapering. I was leery that this thin insert would absorb and not leak but it has worked great so far. I does take longer to dry than microfiber, but I found that it is comparable to other hemp inserts we have. Overall the best bottom system has worked very well as a daytime diaper for us.
My friend is planning on cloth diapering and I know she will need a lot more but these are a great starting insert!

We LOVE the organic cotton/hemp inserts. They're super trim and absorbent. They take forever to dry though. Even after 2 dry cycles and hanging overnight they are still damp. Still, they are our favorite diapers.
These are great. I should have bought hemp inserts from the beginning. They don't stink like the microfiber ones. They are thin.
